clinical_study.brief_title: Subjective Memory Complaints, Objective Memory Performance and Cognitive Training
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Subjective Memory Complaints, Objective Memory Performance and Cognitive Training in Patients With Complex Symptom Disorders

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

oversight_info.authority: Norway:National Committee for Medical and Health Research Ethics

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to examine if repetitive computerized cognitive training improves working memory in patients who are on sick leave due to complex symptom disorders (chronic pain, chronic fatigue, anxiety, depression and or sleep disorders), and whether effects of cognitive control training transfer to other tasks.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: objective memory performance as assessed by neuropsychological tests from CANTAB (SWM, OTS, SST) including PASAT

secondary_outcome.description: correlation with depression, anxiety, fatigue, pain and sleep problems
Transfer to inhibition is demonstrated by significantly reduced Stop Signal Reaction Time on The Stop Signal Task

arm_group.description: Subjects participating in a vocational rehabilitation program will receive systematic cognitive training for 5 weeks.Cogmed working memory training is a computer-based solution. Subjects are instructed to train each weekday (5 days a week) for 5 weeks. Each training session lasts about 40-50 minutes, subjects are asked to complete a set consisting of 8 different tasks, each designed to train working memory.
These subjects will participate in the vocational rehabilitation program for 3,5 weeks. The program includes cognitive therapy (ACT) and physical activity. They will not receive cognitive training.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- on sick leave due to complex symptom disorders: chronic pain, chronic fatigue, anxiety, depression and/or sleep disorders
- on sick leave for at least eight weeks.
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe mental disorder
- acute psychosis
- ongoing manic episode
- suicidal ideation
- ongoing abuse of alcohol or any other substance.
- not able to communicate in Norwegian
